Long Call.description: Used when expecting a strong bullish move.

Bull Call Spread.description: A bullish strategy with limited risk and limited profit. Used when expecting a moderate rise in price.

Bull Put Spread.description: Used when expecting a moderate rise in price or no change. A credit spread used to generate income.

Covered Call.description: Used to generate income on a long stock position in a flat to slightly bullish market.

Long Future.description: A simple bullish strategy using a futures contract, with no defined risk or profit limits.

Long Put.description: Used when expecting a strong bearish move.

Bear Put Spread.description: A bearish strategy with limited risk and limited profit. Used when expecting a moderate fall in price.

Bear Call Spread.description: Used when expecting a moderate fall in price or no change. A credit spread used to generate income.

Protective Put.description: Used to hedge a long stock position against a price drop.

Short Future.description: A simple bearish strategy using a futures contract, with no defined risk or profit limits.

Strangle.description: Similar to a Straddle but with a wider profit range, used for high volatility. Cheaper to enter but requires a bigger price move.

Straddle.description: Used when expecting a significant move in either direction (high volatility). Profit is unlimited.

Iron Condor.description: A non-directional, income-generating strategy used in low volatility. Limits both risk and profit.

Iron Butterfly.description: A non-directional, income-generating strategy used for very low volatility. Requires the price to stay in a narrow range.

Long Butterfly (Call).description: A low-risk strategy used when expecting a flat market. The max profit is at the middle strike price.

Synthetic Long Stock.description: Used to replicate the profit/loss profile of owning a stock using options. Based on the concept of put-call parity.

Collar.description: A risk-management strategy used to protect a long stock position while limiting upside profit and generating some income.

Calendar Spread (Call) multi-expiry.description: Used when expecting moderate volatility but a flat price in the short term. Profits from time decay of the short-term option.

Diagonal Spread (Call) multi-expiry.description: Similar to a Calendar Spread but uses different strike prices, offering more flexibility.

Double Diagonal multi-expiry.description: A complex, non-directional strategy used to profit from time decay. It is essentially an Iron Condor using diagonal spreads.

Synthetic Covered Call.description: Replicates a covered call using futures. A long futures position is hedged with a short call to generate income.

Synthetic Protective Put.description: Replicates a protective put. A long futures position is hedged with a long put to limit downside risk.

Futures Calendar Spread.description: Profits from time decay and a difference in price between near-term and long-term futures contracts.
